name: J R
text: Took my truck here in Oct of 2020 and they forgot to reconnect the sway bar up front, which I fixed. Then gave them a second chance with my wife's car and just discovered they only replaced 3 of the 5 lug bolts on one wheel. Now I have to buy new lug bolts. Go somewhere else if you want the job done correctly.

resp.text: Our apologies that we did not meet your expectations, not what we want to have happen! I see that we have already opened a customer service ticket, we will be back in touch soon!

name: Amanda
text:
As a woman I can say that I have never had a good experience in places when getting my car serviced.  I am spoken down to, given hidden charges, and just treated with general disrespect.
But this was absolutely not the case coming here. Ricky was incredibly nice and spoke to me like an actual human being. I told him what I needed and what time I needed it done. Not only was it done in the exact time I needed, he called to verify what we discussed and verify the price. He did not try to sell my anything unnecessary. And the price wasn't a penny over what he told me. It was an amazing experience and it will be the only place I get my car serviced for the foreseeable future. Thank you for your respect and impeccable service.

resp.text: Thanks for the stars, Amanda! Glad the team was able to take such great care of you. Take care!

name: Kevin Stephens
text: This review is more for an employee than the store itself. Not to take away from the store, though, the store is great. Tire Tech, Ricky, deserves a large amount of praise. That gentleman works his behind off. Every time I’m in the store, he’s there. Working hard. He’s got a fantastic attitude and a general willingness to help. If someone from Tire Discounters sees this, give that man a raise.

resp.text: Awww, thank you for the 5-star review and the kind comments Ricky. We are so glad you had a great experience Kevin, we do what we do for customers just like you. Please come back and see us again when you need us and stay safe out there!

name: Claire Tomlin
text:
Fantastic service! They helped me with my tire issue and Ima go back to them for all my tire needs!

Pros: Honest and down to earth; easy to talk to!

Cons: a bit standoffish at first but it may have been the weather (Torrential downpour)

resp.text: That’s how we rock so you can roll Claire! Thank you for the feedback and 5-star review! We work hard to provide you with a great experience. Please come back to see us again when you need us. Stay safe out there!

name: William Swinson
text: Joseph the manager and his staff have been phenomenal. Great prices and the service is simply outstanding. He and his team helped me solve a major problem that 2020+ Ram 1500 have major complaints about due to tire shimmy at certain speeds. They fixed the entire problem by performing a “dynamic balancing” splitting the needed weights and road force validation. So these folks saved me from a problem that most folks can’t figure out. Truck runs smooth as silk now and these guys were a pleasure to work with. I will NEVER NEVER take my vehicles anywhere else. You guys just made me a customer for life. Just so you know, I make a living teaching organizations how to be efficient and “customer-centric” and these guys rock !!!! Thanks guys!!!!! Ed

resp.text: That’s how we roll, William! Glad we were able to take such good care of you. Thanks, and we’ll see you again down the road!

name: Ryan Cass
text: For the last 5 years I’ve been taking my Camry to NTB in Huntsville and they were fine until they started trying to up sell me on stuff I didn’t need and their prices kept going up with the staff becoming less and less friendly too. When Tire Discounters opened up on Winchester road I looked forward to trying them out since they are much closer and after having some work done on my other vehicles I knew this would be the right place to get a fresh set of tires. They had a great sale going on for Pirelli’s and they are driving great, hopefully they maintain their friendly service and good prices because this is where I’ll be going for the life of my new tires.

resp.text: We rock so you can roll! We're the authority in customer service and auto safety, Ryan. See ya in 5000 miles for your 1st of many free lifetime tire care visits. We want to take make sure we take good care of those new puppies.

The woman said we should have made appt anyway.  Well we did... we told her when we walked through the door. So she looked and got pretty nervous.  They got us in ASAP ands we finally got the tire fixed.  Overall we will use our tire discounters on W72 and county line. We were out of town and Hampton Cove was thre closest. Good luck if you use them.

resp.text: Terry, our apologies that we did not meet your expectations, not what we want to have happen! We definitely care about your experience and we'd like to connect to learn more. If you would like to discuss, please send your preferred contact information to support@tirediscounters.com so we can get back in touch with you. Please include a copy of your review for reference, we hope to hear back from you soon! Thank you and stay safe!

text: My day started out with a flat tire on my car. I took my car here and the nice staff at tire discounters did not hesitate to fix my tire for me! 10/10 would be back again.

resp.text: That’s how we rock so you can roll Madison! Thank you for the feedback and 5-star review! We work hard to provide you with a great experience. Please come back to see us again when you need us. Stay safe out there!

text: Awesome service! The staff is very  quick, attentive and professional. They patched my SUV for FREE and cleaned the wheels. We were just about to head out for a road trip so this was great. I'll definitely be coming back when those tires need to be replaced.

resp.text: Rockin' and rollin'! Glad we could keep ya rollin' safely, Dan. Hope you enjoyed your trip and we'll see ya again when ya need us.

name: Stefanie Terrell
text: Do not take your vehicle here unless you’d like something coincidentally to happen requiring an additional repair. My husband took his vehicle here for a tire patch which resulted in him being told he needed new tires due to uneven wear. He received a quote and agreed to pursue the new tire service. During service, he was told that his alignment was extremely off; although he had taken his vehicle to the dealership for routine maintenance. They drove his vehicle to our house (courtesy drop-off) and didn’t even mention that the vehicle was making a grinding noise when accelerating and slowing down (4WD issue). Deceitful and dishonest. Their management told my husband that this was a coincidence and a known issue with the make and model of his vehicle. Then proceeded to give him a quote to repair. BUYER BEWARE

resp.text: We have strict policies in place to never oversell unnecessary items and follow MAP guidelines when making any product or service recommendations. We would like to connect you with a TD Rep to learn more and address your concerns, Stefanie. Would you mind sending your preferred contact information to tirediscounters.com/contact? We look forward to connecting.

name: Stephanie Foster
text:
We Saturday at 4:59pm ( yes it was closing time on a Saturday night) we called over to this place, explained to them what was going on we limped to their parking lot we were told they did not have the tire and that they were closed. Just as we were pulling in Mike, the manager was coming out of the garage (while calling other locations to see if they had the tire size we needed) to let us know what he had already done in 60 seconds!!!! After getting Mike the correct tire size, that he had in stock, he was pulling us in to get the old tire off and new tire on. Scott kept us company and checked us out! These guys were able to get us in and out and back on the road quickly! Despite it being closing time on a Saturday night Mike and Scott were there to provide outstanding customer service, quick action and a can do attitude!  Thank you guys again for everything!

Johnny Lavalais

name: Sean Copenhaver
text:
So there I was, just dropped the kids off at school with minutes to spare, running a little behind on my way into work, and with my tire low on air the entire time! It truly felt like a Monday indeed. The caution light erupts to life on my dashboard nearly blinding me, my rear driver side tire...is low on air. *Que dramatic music*
I pull into the nearest mechanic shop and park right in front of the first available bay. They were all open and currently being mopped by the staff. Before I have a chance to throw the car in park, there is a young man walking my way. With the car now in park, I step out of the car and he greets me with a warm smile and a "Good Morning to ya, what can we help with?", but before I have a chance to open my mouth he whistles in shock at the sight of my tire. When I turn around to see the damage, there it is, staring me in the face like a angry mother-in-law when you make an inappropriate joke at the dinner table, a screw.
Now there's two men attending to my car. Courtney, the first-responder, and Lamar, the muscle. The elect to change out the tire and find what they have in stock. 2 good conversation and half a cup of cheap coffee later I've got keys in my hand and ready to start my day. I made it to work on time too for anyone who was wondering.

resp.text: We are so appreciative for you sharing your story. These guys really do work hard to try to be a positive impact in people's lives. Some may say, "you guys just change oil." but we like to say, "we're not just changing oil, we're changing lives!" we strive to be the best 10 minutes in a customers day. thank you for your business and we are so grateful again for your kind words.

name: Ernest G Waters
text: Update to previous review.  Since my initial visit to the McGee rd service facility back in December,  which did an excellent job, I have had 2 bad experiences.  1st bad experience was with my wife's car. She had the oil changed at the eastern blvd facility.  Approximately 1 week later her car's check engine light came on and the fault was for dirty oil. She had the oil checked at a local change facility and it was a quart low. They did another oil change, and I have the filter from that change and it is not as clean a filter as you think from 1 week previous. I had also gotten my oil changed in my truck a few days after she did at the eastern Blvd facility.  So I decided to take a look at my oil and filter. The filter on my truck had an install date written on it from the McGee Rd facility of 12/9/19. The date I first got Express to change it. They supposedly changed my oil and filter on 2/7/20 at McGee rd. I will also attach a pic of the filter . Needless to say this is a very bad way to run a business.  Engine damage from dirty oil is very significant possibility from these action.

resp.text: Hi there, Ernest. While we never like for a customer to leave unsatisfied, feedback like this helps us grow as a company. Thank you for taking the time to leave a review! We value your business and would love to address your concerns as quickly as possible. When you have time, please leave us your contact information as well as the details you provided here at https://www.expressoil.com/contact/ so we can work to resolve your issue. Thank you!

I hope you will see this is much more than just an oil change that some others out there are offering. we hope to earn your business and your trust.

[Note] They're not just an alignment shop. Other than paint, body, or stereo work they can do basically anything you need from brakes to a full engine rebuild.

text: I can't overstate how much I appreciate this shop.  Long Lewis Ford gave me an estimate for over $4,000.00 for a new transmission (E350 drivetrain).  I came to Bacon for a second opinion because the owner is a transmission expert.  Turns out the transmission is fine.  I paid $35.00 for the assessment.  Previously, I had Bacon do a transmission service at 195,000 miles on my Ford F-150.  They fixed a glitch that Ford dealers could never get a handle on - when I accelerated hard between 30-40 mph, it would miss.  No longer!

name: rtc
text:
Went in for new shocks and coils, they installed them well, but when I started driving, my vehicle constantly pulled to the left. If I didn't hold the steering wheel tight it would have flipped at high speeds. So I called them and they swore they had done an alignment. I asked if they'd check again to make sure it was done right and they begrudgingly said yes. Took it back in, they said everything looked great. I drove it off the lot and there was still a severe pull to the left. They blamed my tires and said it's because they had a bad wear pattern. (My tires were only a few months old).

So I took it to another place on the other side of the river. They did an alignment and told me that whoever had done my previous alignment lied to me. They showed me on a print out how the camber was over an inch out of line and how the toe of one wheel was turned too far in. I drove off the lot and my vehicle drove as straight as an arrow.

Bacon Alignment lied to me twice and charged me for something they didn't do. Avoid.

text: Super grateful for this business and Brian. Our family was traveling home from Florida and our back tire went out 4 hours into our 14 hour drive, we went to Walmart first and they didn’t have our tire size, and we called down to Express Oil Change and they told us to bring our car down And at the very least would get our spare on so we could get somewhere that had our tire size as they didn’t have one in stock either. They called down to another Express Oil Change 10 miles away who had one for us. Instead of putting our young family on a spare tire in an area we didn’t know, they drove down and got the tire for us and changed it there. They had us back on the road in about an hour and half. While I don’t know when we will be back through, I will forever be grateful for their kindness, and professionalism and highly recommend them if you are traveling through.

resp.text: Thank you for trusting us with your vehicle's maintenance needs and making Express Oil Change & Tire Engineers your shop of choice! We appreciate your business and thank you for taking the time to share your experience at our shop Kendra!

They were excellent, professional, and very great at making sure I got the best deal! Sam, the assistant manager, was always following up and taking care of anything that came up! text: I pulled in to an empty parking lot and empty bays. I explained that I wanted an oil change and an alignment. After my oil change my car was put in the parking lot and the shop filled up. Other cars started getting aligned and my car sat there for almost an hour. After asking about it they then put my car on the rack. When I was ready to check out. It gets better. They tell me they couldn’t alignment my tires because it had to be weighted and go to the dealership. (Added: Which is a lie. I was able to take it to NTB and get aligned the next day.) This was my first time at this location and I will not be back.

name: Britt Noelle
text: I happened to be traveling through Calera on my way home, and unfortunately got a flat tire. It was the perfect storm of bad timing, incredibly delayed roadside service, and the literal annoyance of cold and rainy weather. I looked up tire mechanics in the area and happened upon these guys. After a couple of calls to let them know i was still awaiting a tow truck, we realized I might not even make it to them before closing time. And on top of that, if it was deemed that I did need a new tire, they might not have what I needed. It was at this point that the managers asked me where I was located! Wyatt and Sam actually drove to where I was, helped me put my spare tire on, and assisted me safely to the shop. They were busy, and still took incredible care of me. I truly can't thank the team there enough. The customer service is off the charts. Everyone was personable and kind, the shop itself is clean and orderly, and they got me taken care of super fast! Honestly, I am just so thankful to have encountered such a great team. Its too bad I'm not a local, but I'm very thankful that it was in Calera that my tire blew. :) THANKS AGAIN Y'ALL!!

resp.text: Hi, Britt, thank you for the positive feedback! Our team here at Express Oil Change & Tire Engineers is always happy to service your vehicle, and we’re thrilled to hear the customer service was stellar. We look forward to continuing to do business with you in the future!

he told me 20 min. an hour and a half later, no one even came to tell me it was taking a little longer and at one point a customer pulled into the lot and almost drove into the bay because no one was in the oil change area. the driver got out and walked into the waiting room and asked "where are all the employees" i told her i had not seen anyone in a while, she got back in her car and left. terrible customer service.

text: I can think of 3 times you guys (all under the watchful eye of Chase) have come to my rescue in less than years time. Second time through trial and error we got my A/C up and running. Then most recently I found my self having to make frequent trips to bham and my car started overheating.  You guys got it right in and fixed that too!!!  Just got back from Bham and not once did it even act like it was thinking about over heating.  HEROS I tell ya!!!!!!  You guys rocks.  Thank you so much.  See ya in 3 months for my next oil change!!!!

name: Sierra Eutsey
text: I've been coming to RoadMart for two years now and I am now having the worst time with them. I brought my car in a week ago because the front end of the car was not driving properly. RoadMart said that they could not replicate the issue but they did see I needed my tires balanced, I let them balance my tires and when I left I was having the same issues. I brought my car back and then they said the tires were  separating on the inside, so I paid 367 for four brand new tires. Replacing the tires only helped the car drive smoother but the problem was now worse! So I brought my car back today and now there saying that the back tires are the cause of the front tires shifting and that wasn't something they could fix, I would have to take it to the dealership. The guy said he could try to align the front to see if that would help but it made the issue even worse then when I had initially brought the car in. I am now sitting here after closing hours so they can set my alignment back to were it was. I just feel like if they were unable to repair the car in the first place then they should've said so instead of me coming out of 446 dollars for no reason. I asked if I could a refund for the alignment and the guy said that he wouldn't be able to refund me, would have to wait until next call and ask for a refund or he could credited as two free oil changes which is not acceptable for my inconvenience

name: James McCain
text: You drop your car off seven or eight days later no one calls you they tell your car is done and it cost $2000 to fix they fix my car with no approval I said OK paid the bill picked it up less than 10 days later I start to hear funky noise like something is loose then transmission fluid starts pouring all out of it  end it won’t move they send a wrecker after it same thing car sits there for almost 4 weeks no one calls me tells me the car is done I come to pick it up drive home put about 400 miles on it guess what car won’t move call him they tell me to bring it in don’t even offer it to tow it back wake they came and got it finally Repeated the same thing 3Weeks later I called to check on my car how they say it’s ready to go said they had a fluid leak told me that park the car out front I come to pick it up it’s dark and raining guess what the car won’t start won’t crank nothing popped the hood the negative battery cable was loose reconnect it car still is dead as a hammer. It’s late it’s dark come back the next day car won’t even jumpstart the battery is so dead go to get a battery put a battery in it started and the emergency brake light won’t go off like they adjusted the emergency break wrong drive it home will never go back oh by the way when I went to pick it up the driver side floor board was full mud . Don’t take your car there

name: Leah Autumn
text: I contacted Alabama Precision Transmission to get an estimate on a new transmission for my Nissan. I spoke with Michael (Mike) and he worked hard and got me the best deal possible! He went above and beyond to get me what I needed and I would never go anywhere else!

text: Great guys to work with, great attention to detail and take pride in their work.

name: Kaitlyn Shotwell
text:
My car broke down about 20 miles south of Montgomery, and the Firestone on Maxwell AFB recommended this place as a reputable transmission specialist. My first impression walking in was not favorable, as the owners smoke indoors and it is not well maintained. I would say the highlight of this place is the employees, because they were super helpful and polite as my car was put into the garage. Be careful if you have insurance; once I brought up that my insurance might cover the work, the owner got really shady and kept telling me that it wasn't a good idea to contact my insurance company. I ended up leaving my car here for about a week and I heard no updates from the store and they wouldn't answer any phone calls. I decided I didn't want to conduct business with these folks anymore. When I finally got the owner on the phone, he protested that the job would cost me about $6,000, but calling around and showing the invoice to other mechanics in the area, they told me they would do the same job for about $4,000. I ended up having the car towed to the dealership because of the bad vibes I got with APT.

In summary, I cannot attest to their expertise fixing the car, but I definitely didn't like their low level of professionalism. Two and a half stars.

name: Tara Goode

text: Didn't know it was that hard to get tires. I guess know the mode is find a place like above or Sam's club maybe.  Called the above yesterday,gave them car info, ordered tires, called today at 2pm to come on down for the install. In less than an hour, got all 4 installed. Very, quick friendly and efficient,  I think we found our new place for oil changes too!! Thank you, Matthew.

name: John Petit
text: To anyone in the Foley, Gulf Shores and Orange Beach area who needs engine repair, please strongly consider Fausak.  I gave them 5 stars and took the time to write a review and here is why.  They performed the service review on my 2015 Toyota Avalon with 70K miles and it was missing badly and seemed like a coil pack problem.  The original diagnosis and estimate came in around $650.  I gave them the verbal to proceed and they called back an hour and half later to tell me that their original diagnosis was incorrect and that they found the problem.  A beach mouse/rodent chewed the fuel line to one of the cylinders and the bill would be $136 parts and labor.  I was overjoyed and consider that an incredible testimony to their honesty and integrity.  I will do business with them whenever I can in the future and I recommend them highly.

resp.text: John, we appreciate you sharing your experience. It is important to our business to treat our customers with respect and honesty when it comes to their auto repair needs. Thank you for coming to us with your Toyota Avalon and we look forward to working with you next time!

name: Mike Cents
text: Matt from Fausak is our go-to guy. His team of mechanics is amazing. Matt consistently has a great attitude and always tries to help no matter the issue at hand. Do yourself a favor and acquaint yourself with Fausak.

name: Tony Chapman
text: Stopped by without an appointment due to a tire on my travel trailer losing air. We were greeted and immediately taken into a bay for service, the technician quickly discovered the problem and the tire was repaired and mounted. Very professional service writers and technicians ×ith a new and modern facility. We were back on the road to continue our vacation all within an hour.  Thank you.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us, Tony. It was our pleasure to quickly diagnose the issue with your trailer tire and get you back on your vacation in no time!

name: Joan Harris
text: My son got a nail in his tire, and it went flat on the interstate in Mississippi.  When he changed his tire to the spare, he broke the stud that holds the lug nut on.  With some calling and stress, I got him to our vacation spot in Orange beach.  I called Fausak and talked to Raymond (who was very kind). They were so accommodating, fixed his tire, and even found another nail in another tire and fixed it.  They did it quick and we were back to our vacation within an hour.  I highly recommend this place.

resp.text: It was our pleasure to take care of the punctured tires on your son's vehicle and get your family back to your vacation! We appreciate you sharing this experience and if there are any auto repair or tire services we can assist with in the future, just let us know!

name: M. Tyler Arthur
text: Stopped in to check a deflated tire and was told a ( perfectly fine otherwise) tire cannot be repaired/plugged more than once. Upon a quick search - this isn't the case at all! Fausak will not see my cars again. Honesty and trust are most important to me and was let down on both fronts.

resp.text: Mr. Arthur,  Thank you for reaching out to us and pointing out our miscommunication.  Your tire had a puncture that was too close to a prior repair and together the repairs would have overlapped.  This makes the tire unsafe to repair according to the Tire Industry Association and the US Tire Manufacturers Association.  Our top priority is the safety of all our guests and employees, and ultimately every other car on the road.  We failed to explain these guidelines accurately which led to the misunderstanding and for that we apologize.  We have sent a copy of the excerpts from each of these guidelines to you.   If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to reviews@fausaktire.com or call the Foley store.  Thank you.

name: Garrett Smith
text:
I had came in to get a tire changed. Place was packed out, that's cool, I dont mind.
They have the tire I want but can't put it on the day of because of time constraints, that's okay.
The manager, who's name I will withhold, told me that no other tire shop was open that day and I would have to come back on Monday, although I had already came from Walmart TLE and they were changing tires.
I go up the road and to the other Express Oil and tire center. They have my size tire and change it for me.
Now why the manager of this store lied to me on both occasions is beyond me. I can only assume he was trying to save his sales instead of trying to help a brother out.

I'll be going to the Express Oil on 280, instead. There's good people there.

name: Tiffany Walls
text: I absolutely ADORE Brian and Tammy! They have serviced my Hyundiai Tucson as well as a second vehicle for our family. In August 2019, I had my AC compressor replaced. I had shopped around some other businesses (including Firestone, which I would NEVER recommend) and I was quoted a far more reasonable price for parts and labor through Brian's. Brian took the time to diagnose my issue, explain what he would do to my vehicle, how the part worked and why the part that needed replacing wasn't working properly. After the repair, Brian took the time to have me look and listen to the new part, showed me the broken part before he disposed of it and even gave me some insight to another belt that may need replacing at a certain point. They won us over with their communication, responsiveness, kindness and honesty. They have customers for life because they did such a stellar job! Wonderful experiences at this shop!

name: Ethan Lake
text: Absolutely the best experience I have had with a mechanic. I called several of the places around to see if I could bring my truck by and this was definitely the friendliest of them. Tammy answered my phone call and was beyond helpful. I instantly took the truck by and Brian greeted me as soon as I arrived. For the first time, a mechanic (Brian) actually took the time to hear me out and see what I thought the issue was. He checked various things in the truck and under the hood. He did a little tinkering and sent me on my way with no more problems! I will definitely be back, and for anyone else new to this area and looking for a place to get your vehicle fixed, go see Brian!

resp.text: Thank you Ethan!  We appreciate your review and look forward to helping you in the future.

name: Cheryl Phillips
text: Went in for tires however I had a brake light and headlight out on the driver side and had asked if they could fix it. I was told to come back that Saturday; May 2nd so that a mechanic can look at it. I went that Saturday and had the lights repaired. That same Saturday night my entire driver side taillight went out. I knew they were closed Sunday but I called just in case I could leave a voicemail to give them a heads up about me coming in on Monday; May 4th regarding the taillight. May 4th they tried to repair the issue however ALL of my lights started malfunctioning. They tell me to come back that Wednesday; May 6th so that their mechanic can look at it. They gave me a work order stating that they are working on diagnosing the problem in case I got pulled over for no brake lights, reverse lights, headlights or turn signal. They proceeded to pull my vehicle through the shop and when I got inside it I noticed an airbag sensor that was not there before. I asked John if he could have it cleared out and he said that he would have the mechanic do it on Wednesday and that it should be no problem. I then attempted to turn my AC on (which was on while they were working on it but John said that he had turned it off) but the AC wouldn't come on. I get out of my vehicle and ask John if he could have the code cleared because I felt that it was messing with the operation of my AC and it's been 90° lately. John then tells another employee named Skyler to come clear the code however the code does not clear. During this time the owner comes and introduces himself and asked me and another customer if we were being tended to, the other customer stated that he was already tended to then I stated that I was being tended to and pointed to my vehicle. The owner then leaves to never return again. They then proceeded to turn the vehicle off in hopes of resetting it however at that point the vehicle would no longer start. John then told me that I needed to leave and that I could return Wednesday to have their mechanic look at it but at this point, I had no dash lights, interior lights, exterior lights, no AC, no radio, no power steering, and sensors going off. The vehicle would no longer start up. I started to get upset, John claims I brought my vehicle in like that which is 100% untrue, I drove it in with no issues other than the driver taillight but I was unable to drive it away. I defended myself and vehicle over that statement then John pulled their doors closed while several employees including a manager/ assistant manager watched. I ended up having to call the police (because I had no clue what else I could or should do). The shop then claimed that I had a bad battery and that was the result of all of this however when they put a brand new battery in there it did NOT fix all the problems, the vehicle did start up and it did have headlights but that was it. After me refusing to tow my vehicle away and almost 2 hours later Mitch (I believe the manager or assistant manager) then offered to let the vehicle stay and have their mechanic look at it on Wednesday May 6th. May 6th, I went to go pick up my vehicle and John was working the front desk, they tried to hand me my keys in the lot hoping I would just leave immediately but when I asked for a full detail work order on what all had been done to my vehicle, I received attitude and was told that I should be happy that they fixed it for free and that they don't document all the work that's done on vehicles. I sat up there until I received a work order (over 30mins later) but when I received the "work order" it stated, "gave customer a battery and replaced 10 fuse". I told the mechanic that that was not a detailed work order but I was told that was all I was going to get. I do not believe that they would have fixed the damages their employee, John, caused to my vehicle if I did not have 4years of documentation from the one and only other mechanic I've been to, video footage from my own vehicle and computer readings from my Vivint smart security proving the condition of my vehicle.

text: Had service which consisted of an oil change, front end alignment and the air filter. All was well, excellent customer service however,  my skid plate wasnt put back on  (advised of the issue AFTER going to Firestone) and I had to go back. They sent a mechanic to try and provide a solution to the problem and he had no clue what it was. I went to Firestone and merely explained what I was hearing and thats when I was advised it was the skid plate. My question is if a Honda certified mechanic heard the issue and didnt know what it was and I again, only told the gentleman at Firestone, not sure I want them servicing my car.

name: Kady Thompson
text: Took my pilot last week to get an issue fixed. The issue started happening again after we picked it up, called and they advised us to bring it back in so we did. Got a call after we dropped it back off,telling us that Honda told them we have to drive it for 5k miles before they will even try to fix the problem again . Very unhappy. It takes us over an hour to get our car to the dealership and wish they would have told us that before they advised us to drive it back over there all for nothing . I still have an issue with my car and will have wasted 2 hours out of my day . We will not be using them again .

text: Always do a great job!

text: I was charged $123 for a diagnosis that I already received from Serra Nissan for free.

name: David King
text: Professional n courteous

name: Andreanna Davis
text: They are absolutely wonderful! I took in my Dad’s 1993 Ford Lightning. We had been having trouble with it going dead and just not running right. Several other local mechanics had tried to fix it with little success. I read about Hesco and decided to give them a try. I’m so glad I did. They got Dad’s truck running perfectly! I will never let anyone else work on it again. They do a great job and great work! I just can’t thank them enough for all they did. Would recommend them highly to anyone.

name: Rick Clark
text: I bought a lotus and it was delivered with a flat tire.  Jeff came out to my house picked up the tire and brought it back the next day to put the tire on and check the pressure in the rest of the tires. He was happy to answer any question I had!  Amazing customer service!  A+!  I will be using them for the service of my car.

name: jeffrey vaughn
text: I grew up next door to Jeff. I remember a day when I looked out and saw a 2nd gen camaro with a blower sitting a foot out of the hood. It was Jeff. I was a kid and did the burnout hand signal..to which he happily obliged. Worked with his lil sis many years later and he still remembered. Genuinely thoughtful and kind dude who exudes knowledge.

name: Bailey Ike
text: The customer service is outstanding, the people working there feel authentic and give the impression they truly care.

name: Radioman
text:
Jeff @ HESCO is unparalleled in his infinite wisdom behind the wheel and under the hood of a car. He has been known to pull a rabbit out of a hat on many occasions. I would not hesitate to take any of my vehicles to him for any reason.
Thanks, Jeff-
Tim @ Rickwood Radio Service

name: Eric Morin
text: At last found a shop to work on my Mazda RX-8 R3 with a twin rotary. Honest diagnosis and job well done. Think it runs better than when I bought it! Thank you Jeff and crew!

resp.text: Thank you for the outstanding feedback, Eric! We are so glad that you were able to find a shop that fit your auto needs, we look forward to working with you and your RX-8 again!

name: Charles B Ireland
text: I have been taking my machine work to Hesco for many years. Best machine shop anywhere. Now that I no longer work on my own vehicles, I intend to entrust them with their care.

resp.text: Charles, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. It is a pleasure to work see you in our machine shop. We are so glad we have gained your long term trust! Let us know if there is anything we can assist you with!

name: Nichole Posten
text: As someone indicated, they do a lot of specialty high end vehicle work but it has been well worth the extra to know that the work is done right.  I have been taking my now 10yr old (beater) Jeep here for 8+ years and will take my new Subaru here.  Joe is great and always has the time to spend explaining anything to you.  He even took my husband and son around the shops to look at all of the cars there.

resp.text: Thank you for your loyalty over the years Nichole, we truly appreciate it!

name: Stephen Wilson
text: These guys do some of the best work in Birmingham. That being said, when you see the Ferraris and classic cars in the parking lot you know you are going to pay a price that matches their level of quality work. Don't let the abrasive or lack of communication keep you from at least getting a written quote from their shop. On a side note, get someone to show you around their facility because it is basically an ever changing museum of mechanical genius. Custom builds, daily drivers, etc it's a pretty cool spot in the heart of downtown. If all else fails, you can walk to Good People Brewery or Regions Park  and drink away your sorrows.

resp.text: Thank you for the good review, Stephen! We appreciate getting your feedback and we hope next time we can deliver a 5-star experience!

name: Lindsay Hobbs
text:
I have nothing but good things to say about Hesco and the people working there! My husband and I were driving from Utah to Atlanta when our car broke down in Birmingham. Even though they were busy, they fit us in and got us back on the road the next day! Not only did they fix our car, but they went above and beyond to make sure that we were taken care of while we were stuck in the city. They even called us a few days later to make sure we had made it to our destination safely and without any problems!
We are SO grateful for Jeff, Joe, and everyone else who took such good care of us! This was by far the best experience we have ever had with a mechanic, and would recommend them to anyone!

resp.text: Thank you for the excellent review, Lindsay! We are glad you arrived safely, and we can't thank you enough for all the kind words. Our goal is to provide our customers with an unbeatable experience every time!

name: Prentice Jones
text: One of my best friends works at this shop so I know they are an A+ shop because Warren is a very good tech.

resp.text: Thank you for the awesome review! We are so glad to have Warren on our team! We appreciate the great recommendation!

name: Jacob Hobbs
text: These are the kind of guys that would take their shirts off their backs to help you. Highly recommend to anyone who appreciates honest and high quality work!

resp.text: We appreciate the great review, Jacob. That is exactly who we strive to be. Thank you for your business, and we hope to see you again!

name: James Gavin
text: On a recent trip from Birmingham back to Atlanta my 2012 Hyundai Equus ran hot about 30 miles outside of Birmingham, we got off at exit 147 wound up having to get it towed back to Birmingham. I didn't know a mechanic in B'ham so I had it delivered to J.B. a Buick dealership, they inspected it for $309 and said that I at the least had a blown head gasket caused by a bad water pump and that it was going to cost me $2215  for them to break down the engine and make sure that there was no further damage with the engine,  and that it could be as much as $4500 to replace all the gaskets through out the engine. NOT TODAY!!! So I did a Google search and came across HESCO, the reviews were great, I spoke with Joe Molina and he arranged to have it tower to HESCO "DESPITE being in the middle of changing locations", they got it in checked it out, started it up, "No white smoke from the tail pipe", turned out to be the water pump, THAT's ALL. I can't recommend Joe Molina and the guys at HESCO Automotive highly enough, they are highly professional, extremely efficient, keep you informed at every juncture of the process, and very reasonable. I am telling ALL my friends and family to take their vehicles to HESCO Automotive. Thanks guys, this was a very stressful situation as I was having to take care of it from Atlanta, Joe you could not have been better.

resp.text: Thank you James! It is great to hear from you and glad we could help you out.  We want to make sure all of our costumes are taken care of and are aware of the repairs needed for their vehicle. We are glad you found us and we could located the problem to your water pump. We truly appreciate your recommendation. Give us a call if you have questions or need anything in the future!

name: Ron Denney
text: I had a bolt sheared off inside my BMW motorcycle wheel. I called Wesco from Hoover and explained the situation and that I lived 90 miles south in Dadeville, AL. I spoke with Joe on the phone. He said bring it in and they would see what they could do for me. They used an easy out to remove the bolt for me quickly and wouldn't even take any money for this service. Great people at WESCO!

resp.text: We really appreciate the excellent review, Ron. We are happy to help. Let us know if there is anything else we can help you with!

name: Ray Clark
text: I have a Z-3 and a 535i and would not let anyone else touch them in Birmingham.  I used to go to Tom Williams for items under warranty and they always found something to fix that did not need fixing.  Anything Joe, Jeff and his folks say, I trust completely.

resp.text: Ray - We cannot thank you enough for your business and the great review! We appreciate being able to work with you.

name: Dawn Brook
text: I took my wife's 07 Murano in for a few repairs and got the same great service as all the exotics Hesco works on. Great guys and service.

resp.text: Roy - Thank you for the great review! It is always a pleasure to be able to work with you and we cannot thank you enough for your business.

name: Katie munkus
text: I was very disappointed with this business. I had to have my car towed here the Wednesday before Thanksgiving. I was told that I would get a detailed estimate the following Monday. I was fine with that. When I called Monday I was told that they had already started replacing and fixing the damaged parts to my car without my permission and without my knowledge. So I specifically said please stop working on it until I get the detailed estimate I was promised and had looked it over. The next day I decided to have my car towed to a different shop that specializes in Volkswagen and Audi cars. When I called Hesco to tell them what I had decided they informed me that my car was almost completely finished. The owner made a decision without my permission yet again and without calling to inform me what was going on. I was highly disappointed that every decision made about my car was made without my input or knowledge. And that my request for them to stop the repairs was completely ignored. This business is very unprofessional and lacks the ability to communicate with their customers. I also feel that I was taken advantage of because I am a woman. Not to mention the repairs done to my car were done wrong. I ended up having to have all the transmission fluid drained and replaced bc they used a brand that is not recommended for German cars. I also had to have the tires rebalanced and aligned bc Hesco didn't properly do that either. I do not recommend this business to anyone.

name: Douglas Smith
text: Apparently Jim Burke Subaru won't work on modified Subaru's (so basically every WRX)... Hesco came through and even purchased the updated software so that they could diagnose my car. Skip Jim Burke and take your modified Subie here.

resp.text: Thank you for the great feedback Douglas, we are glad we were able to help when others fell short.

resp.text: Thank you, Rai for the 5-stars and kind words! We greatly appreciate it.

text: Don't take your Eaton supercharged vehicle here.

text: Perfect service dept, on time with repairs, under quoted amount,  very pleased highly recommend,  they are a little short staffed in tech area, so big repairs take longer but every dealer is having this problem

text: Understaffed for the services they advertise

name: Leigh Wright
text: Service department is professional, courteous and friendly

name: Jennifer Eastep (Texas Girl N Bama)
text: Very professional and friendly staff

name: André Garcia
text:
It's ok for the price.  However the reason they don't get the extra 3 stars is because they are always trying to sell you stuff you don't need, which is why I stooped coming back to this place before. Decided to give it a try and it was the same think.

The service guy called me in the garage to show me "something on my car".  He had the air filter open and he pointed to it and pointed to my EXHAUST MANIFOLD and told me that my injectors and inside "there" was full of  "gunk" and that I needed a fuel injector cleaning for $59.   FIRST, the fuel injectors are NOT inside the EXHAUST MANIFOLD or the air filter.  Second, unless you took apart my valve cover you HAVE NO IDEA how clean/dirty my injectors are.  My car is fairly new which quite low mileage and very well maintained,  don't try to scam me into something that I DON'T need,  or even if I did you wouldn't know simply by pointing to my Exhaust Manifold.

There is a good reason the place across the street "Firestone" was packed with people and they are more expansive and this place was empty.  It's called HONESTY.

resp.text:
Dear André,
We are sorry your last visit to our auto shop did not meet your expectations. Our staff is well trained to identify maintenance issues on each vehicle we diagnose. We are a family owned honest, friendly, and affordable auto maintenance shop. We'd greatly appreciate the opportunity to discuss your concerns further, in hopes of reaching a positive resolution. Please contact one of the owners at your earliest convenience, in hopes of making this right with you. Thank you!
~ Jamie and Rick Martin, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham
(205) 637-5523

name: Jade Howlet
text: I never had an experience so BAD! I get my tires rotated and oil changed. I come back to get the same services done. The mechanic tells me whoever rotated my tires last stripped my lug nut post. When they realize they were the ones who did it they tell me I need to sign a waiver for them to try to fix it or pay for a whole new post! I will never be back!

resp.text:
Dear Jade,
We really appreciate our customers and continuously strive to provide excellent customer service. Our records do not show you as a client of ours. Is there a possibility the transaction is under a different name? We are happy to discuss any issues you might have with your vehicle and try to reach a reasonable solution.
Please give us a call at (205) 637-5523 at your earliest convenience. Thank you!
~ Jamie and Rick Martin, Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Trent Daniels
text: Front desk lady was very nice. The gentleman working on my truck was very informative. I always come here for an oil change, doesnt take long at all. You cant beat these prices

resp.text:
Dear Trent,
We wanted to say a big "thanks" for your nice review. We will certainly pass along the compliments to our staff. We enjoy taking great care of our customers by delivering affordable pricing and efficient services. Customers like you make our jobs rewarding and enjoyable. Thank you!
~Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Justin McClew
text: Nice people that don't do nice work. Took it for the premium oil change. Told me all the belts and hoses looked good, air filter was good everything is topped off, but my radiator was leaking. Soon as I left there was a big vibration in it... Let the car sit for 3days, both radiator hoses needed to be replaced, leaking because of corrosion, the air filter was horrible, the pcv valve was clogged, power steering that doesn't leak was empty and the vibration was because they put 2 quarts more oil than the engine was supposed to have!! Quoted me a price to get a radiator when it was a hose they told me was good!

name: monica mitchell
text: I am sitting here now for the third time since a tune up and oil change last week. As soon as I drive off I noticed my car was missing in a cylinder. Had to come back and get a coil replaced immediately. Also my power steering fluid was extremely low and my coolant level was low. once again drove off and noticed oil burning. I couldn't come right back but came back a few days later and it was the plug gasket. So either it wasn't checked when the oil was drained or the tightest plug too tight. Once again even left after gasket replace and car is still burning oil. Now it smokes too. Telling me it's the axle boot which is messed up but none of this began until immediately after I've left from getting service done here. I'm so disappointed because the last time I was here I had such a good experience I thought I had found my new spot to get work done on my car.

resp.text:
Dear Monica,
We are very sorry you are experiencing auto issues. We have checked our records and our auto center does not show the name used on the review as a customer at our auto shop. We would like to assist you in finding a positive resolution and ask that you give one of us a call at the number shown below. We are happy to talk with you at your earliest convenience. Thanks so much!
~Rick and Jamie Martin, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

(205) 637-5523

name: Kristyn Taylor
text: I drive all the way from Southside to bring my car here. They are faster than that express place, at half the price but with better service.  The last time I was there, the tech noticed how terrible my headlights were and let me know they were running a special to fix them for just $20. Now I don't have to drive with my brights on!

text: DO NOT TAKE YOUR CAR HERE!!! I REPEAT!! SAVE YOUR CAR AND MONEY AND GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!! My husband took his Classic Car here for an detailed  job , after picking up the vehicle the following Monday it would not crank. Upon returning my husband was told that they will not be able to work on his car after receiving the money to fix the issue.

We are saddened to read this review. Our staff has tried to work with your husband and his classic car in a patient, honest, and friendly manner. We feel like we have done everything we could to assist you and wish you all the best.
~Jamie and Rick Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

text: Ive heard this location has been shut down but ive been here recently, great service

resp.text:
Hello Drew,
Your patronage at our auto center is greatly appreciated. Thanks for the compliment on our auto services.

You are correct, we have closed this location and plan to relocate about 25 miles away close to Finley Avenue and Farmers Market. We also have a Precision Tune Auto Care center in Alabaster, which is only 6 miles away from our old Pelham shop.

We hope to see you again so we can continue providing you with excellent auto maintenance services. Thank you!
~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care

name: D F
text: They test the cars they service by flying up and down hilltop business dr as fast as they can.

resp.text:
Dear Drew,
Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We too have noticed that there seems to be a lot of vehicles driving faster than they should on Hilltop Drive. Please know that we have addressed this concern with  our employees and have emphasized how important it is to follow the speed limit at all times. Safety is our number one concern in our shop, and also as we test drive any vehicles. If you have any additional questions, or concerns, please feel free to call the store manager, Kevin Gainey, at (205) 637-5523. Thank you very much!

name: Amy Lynn Butler
text: I WAS a long time client until this weekend when they over charged us (found out too late after spending over $650!!) & my husband gave them instructions to leave our car locked outside of their shop, for us to pick up, since we couldn't come until after they were closed. Not only was our car not outside for us, it was still on the rack with the hood up in the shop!! We had to back track to our house & my husband was late for his job! We are VERY disappointed. We have literally spent thousands there through the years. And we are done.

name: Jennifer Cargile
text:
My husband went in with his CRV on a Saturday about 9am for a normal oil change and a check engine light, was told that he needed some spark plugs and new oil pan gasket (there were NO oil leaks that we had noticed, and we were told it was loosing 80% of its oil) and was told it wouldn't take long at all, maybe an hour,  well he didn't leave until after 12 (receipt said 1217). He asked multiple times if it was ready, was told only 20 more mins, then 30...well 2 hours after the said time he left. We had plans at 11am, so those didn't happen WHICH could have been planned for-like loading up my kids (one being a newborn) in the car and picking him up. No apologies for the extra wait time and never honest about how long it was going to take.
Come that following week, SURPRISE, there was an oil leak on the garage floor AND the check engine light was back on. So we took it back once again. He was told that it was just old oil coming out and it was fine and that some other piece needed to be replaced for the check engine light. Like why wasn't this fixed the first time!? Unless we got super unlucky and something went wrong within the 3/4 day time.

Well now it's about 4 months later and there's still oil spots on the floor!
So we called today, I got a so-so person on the phone and was told to bring it back in, no "oh my goodness! That's not what we like to hear..please bring it back in!" It was just "bring it back".

1st, can we make the comparison on the comment from Ashton Morgan below?? This was the SAME day, the SAME time and my husband remembers talking and waiting with Ashton.
We aren't very knowledgable on car repairs and we should've gotten a 2nd opinion(the Garage in Pelham is literally walking distance and everyone always has great things to say about them, but this was just for a cheap oil change-never again!) ..but we just had a baby and didn't have much spare time or sleep to decide these things with a clear mind.

I just reccomend going somewhere else for piece of mind EVEN for an oil change, even if this was just a random bad day (which look at the rating-use your brains people! We didn't and now we're paying for it with our time and now a nasty driveway and garage floor) for the people working on cars, there has yet to be a verbal apology-and now if we get one it will just seem forced.

resp.text:
Dear Jennifer,
My name is Rick and I am the owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham. We wanted to apologize for the long wait during your last visit with us. We know our customers time is valuable and we always strive to provide a reasonable time estimate on each service we perform. I can assure you we addressed the waiting issue and are thrilled to have a new store manager.

Our records show we serviced your vehicle in early February 2016. We offer a 12-month warranty on all services and encourage you to contact us at (205) 637-5523 to set up a follow-up appointment. Since your vehicle has over 189,000 miles on it, there may be another leak requiring some attention. We look forward to making this right with you. Thank you!

name: Covenant Wildlife
text: Decided to give this new location a shot with one of my companies trucks that needed tires. After they installed the tires I left and within 30 min the TPS light came on. The technician never calibrated the sensors. I called the store and told them what happened and the guy said to bring it back by and I told him that it would have to be tomorrow as I had a full route planned and did not expect it to take over 2 hours to just install 4 tires and that I was late for my customers. I asked if I could bring it by in the am and he said that was fine that the tech would calibrate the sensors and that it would only take a min to do. I show up this am  (after clearing some time on my calendar) and I tell the guy who I am and what I am there for and he informs me that they have no mechanic available to do this and that I would have a pretty long wait. I tell him that if the tech did his job correctly, I would not even have to be here a second time. He just says sorry. So I make an appointment for Tuesday to come back a tired time for something the tech should have done right in the beginning. I will take my fleet plus my personal cars elsewhere. Probably go right next door to Christian Brothers.

name: Craig Winn
text: Love the Firestone auto care locations. One of the service reps from the Pelham location is moving here. Great guy and lots of help. Looking forward to this addition in our neighborhood.

name: Richard Thompson
text:
Spend your hard-earned money elsewhere.
I spent 10 minutes on the phone the day before letting the guy know that I was in search of a car mechanic I could trust to tell me what NEEDS to be fixed on my car, not what makes them the most money.  He assured me they would take care of me and he completely understood and that I could trust them.  The next day, after bringing my car in, it was clear they were trying to upsell with strong recommendations for everything from new tires (still have 5k-10k of tread) to all new brakes and rotors for the whole car to the $130 "fuel treatment system", to a NEW SUSPENSION FOR MY CAR.  Yes, they tried to recommend I buy a new suspension system.

I will never go there again and will go find a different mechanic I can trust.

name: Julia Thomason at Love the Mouse Travel
text: Fast and friendly service! I had something stuck in my tire and I only had to wait about 30 minutes for them to repair it and get it back on my van. I will definitely be back!

name: Richard Gayheart
text: My initial experience was pleasant and we discussed what was necessary to fix the truck. I needed to order a specialty part to finish the work. When I brought the part in, there was a different person running the front. At that point, things went downhill. Now I needed several new parts. The person was condescending and spoke to me like I didn’t have a clue. After I explained I had cleared the repairs with the first person and we had emailed the parts needed, this new person demanded to see the email. I retrieved the email and the reply was ‘wow, that was an expensive part’ and told me I needed more parts. I left the store because further conversation was not going to improve the situation. The next day I called the store and spoke with the original front person. My issues were resolved and the truck was fixed, but I will not return based on the second person I interacted with.

name: Tim Hedderly
text: Employees are friendly and personable.  I live in Helena, but will (am) traveling to the 280 location for this service.

name: Brent Curtin
text: I'm a little disappointed.  i went in to see if they could patch my tire.  its run flat so they said they couldn't.  said i need to buy a new tire.  that's ok.  was told that at other locations.  but then he told me that i need 2 new tires on the back as well.  my car is brand new and has 18,000 miles on it and i know tires can go bad at 18,000 miles, unlikely, but can happen.  that was a real turn off trying to sell something not needed.  when i used to go to another of their locations in mobile, the girls and guys down there had me running on slicks before they tried to sell me a tire.  they made sure i didnt buy tires until i really needed them and they had my loyalty.  trying to rip people off isnt a way to get return customers especially when they are putting competition right across the street from you.  just my opinion.

resp.text:
Andrew – We cannot find any Andrew Roberts as a customer since 2012, and that was for only $185. We did try to call the last number in our records to reach out, but that number no longer works.  Perhaps this review was incorrectly posted to the wrong business?

If you visited us under another name, we would like to talk and better understand this situation, as we always educate customers about concerns first, and never sell services or repairs they do not need.  205-663-6088.  Thank you.

text: Poor communication and double talk - two bad experiences in a row. I would steer away from this place. Maybe they were good at one time but not any more.  I want to do loyal business with an honest repair shop. This isn’t it!

resp.text:
Mr Boyd -  1) Our communication with our customer, your son, was clear.  2) Your son only paid for the diagnostic on his first visit, chose not to make repairs, and was appreciative of our thoroughness. 3) After taking his vehicle to another shop that made some attempt at repairs, he returned to us asking us to fix a couple of the critical issues of the many we diagnosed.  The fact that some key parts needed are unavailable for this particular vehicle is no fault of his or ourselves or speak to the skill and talent of our technician, nor the honesty of our business. 4) After we communicated to your son we could not source parts needed, we agreed to remove the parts we had already installed and did not charge his any labor for this authorized work.

We are disappointed to find a review not based on your own experience with us a customer.  Negative reviews with no merit harm our business and our hard-working employees and their families.  Had you been involved in each piece of communication, you would find our recommendations were in the best interests of your son, were clear, and in the end – your son did not pay for parts or any of the hours of work our technician performed.  We understand your sons vehicle needs are very frustrating. We hope he finds a solution quickly, and you get your own vehicle back soon.  If any customer ever has questions or concerns, I am always available to help at 205-663-6088. - Doug Melton

name: Whit Allen
text: Melton's was recommended to me from a friend who has been using them for years.  My car was repaired and returned in an expected time frame and cost under estimated price.  04 Tundra.  Very pleased and will be back when necessary.

resp.text: Whit - We appreciate the review and the 5 stars!  Thank you for the kind words.

text: New to Melton's, we have used them twice now took great care of us/our cars and they haven't tried to find a list of other things we need done to pad the bill. There prices are the average in our area. Nice staff, oh and if you don't live too far away they will drive you home after you drop of your car, nice service not offered by many places.

resp.text: Thank you Merry for the wonderful review! We are always more than happy to help customers our with whatever their needs are! Thank you for putting your trust in us!

name: Alyssa Oliver
text:
Called up there to schedule a drop off. Because they had good reviews. Not the friendliest person who answered the phone. That's fine but when I told him what was going on he said we dont do transmission work. My problem is it says they do on their website. Rude and waste of time. Going to add to the post I was discriminated against I guess because I'm a woman. my husband called the place and said exactly what I said the problem
Was and they told him yes they do that there.

resp.text: Hello Mrs. Oliver. We do not rebuild transmissions, but we do remove and replace transmissions with either used transmissions or remanufactured transmissions. A gentleman called yesterday and obtained a price to replace the torque convertor. I am not sure if this was your husband or not, but we can replace a torque convertor because it is physically attached to the transmission and is not an internal part. I believe there may have been some miscommunication as to what was required to repair the vehicle/transmission. Alabaster Automotive, LLC prides itself in servicing EVERYONE in the community and we do not discriminate against anyone based on sex, ethnicity, religion, etc. If you would like to discuss this matter further, please feel free to reach out to me with a phone call. Thank you.

Fantastic service !

name: Andrae Antwoine
text: They explain, very professional, but not accountable for any mistakes.  I have 4 kids and wife, the expense was necessary..they had to replace spark plugs, explained that if removed, Its a possibility some will break off...well 1 got stuck in the engine.....it requires taking everything out and restructure how it was before...with no mistakes...so it took 2-3 weeks to get it done...after 3100$ mechanic informed us #1 he drove the car 65 miles testing the truck..no gas reimbursement (not considering our financial needs)....#2.that our sensor light was not working, (but we never had an issue with it),they didn't charge us for replacing it, but now it  ironically reads an alternator light.  #3 The mechanic simply said, i don't know why it came on, but it needs to be replaced. Although, your safe to drive it home.   #4. 2 weeks later, a great amount of smoke begins to shoot out exhaust...that very day, I took it to another auto place to get it assessed. (my red flags were to much).The other repair shop did not go into detail, but towed it back to alabaster, free of charge told them the issue and Alabaster Auto's  said "we'll give them a call".  #5 2 days later, I called them...ask "what is the problem?" they replied: The fluid injectors ironically messed up within 2 weeks, causing oil to spill onto the motor, "washing it out"...not only did they tell me an alternator was needed, but now I have to buy a new motor. Their excuse was....this is all a coincidences. they don't know why these thing are happening to my ford expedition that is under 120,000 miles. I called the other auto store to come and get it...I'll pay them what is necessary, but I am not spending another dime at alabaster Auto's.  We are taking legal action against them immediately after proof of fault. I can't except "it's all a coincidence".

resp.text: Andrae, one of our goals is to be honest and forthright with our customers. Also, we make every effort to ensure our customers are satisfied.  We deeply regret not being able to do so in your situation.

Thanks. Ben

name: Dayon Lane
text:
Do NOT aide this place. My CRV had to go in to have the fan assembly replaced. Upon getting it back I saw that my A/C no longer blew cold and my automatic window function no longer worked. Then, when taking it in to be looked at, I found that they BROKE what holds to coolant reservoir and just had it sitting, and it was empty. They had lost two of the caps on the front, AND they didn’t attach the grill back correctly.

I called them and they said to bring it in Saturday. I head that way and call them to tell them I’m on the way. And they inform me not to come Bc they are not able to do it Saturday and to come Monday. Isn’t an option for me. I paid $532 for them to essentially break my car. WILL never go back.

Recently car wasnt  starting had to jump off took car to 2 places to check battery and alternator checked (free)was told it was alternator so took in here and they checked said it was the battery which I have no problem with but when I got there it was 42 dollar. Guess I should have asked first just assumed the shop that did the work would have done it free too.  Lesson learned I guess.

name: kevin armstrong
text: I came here to have a plug put in my trailer tire. I waited and was told to back my truck around. When i started backing in someone else whips in and i was forced to stop. He comes up to my window and tells me to wait just a minute and let him take care of this customer. I waited another 10-15 minutes. He finally plugs my tire, i pay and leave. I drive 1/2 Mile home. Get up the next morning and the tire is low again. I drive back down there and tell them something was wrong. There was one person in the lobby and he tells me the wait would be at least one hour to put air in my tire. I had to unload several things from my trailer to get to tools needed for me to put air in it myself. I did this in there parking lot as they say inside and watched me. They won't make there wrongs right. Expert tire is right across the street.

resp.text: Kevin, when we reached out it sounded like you had no issues with your experiences at our shop after we offered to assist in any way we could. If there are any further concerns, please reach out to us as we would like to clear up any misunderstandings. Thank you.

name: Chase Miller
text:
First time customer, came in off recommendation from a friend.

Staff friendly, clean waiting room, good location, fair advertised prices.

3 stars due to being told over phone an oil change would be 20-30 mins wait, showed up 20 mins after the call and I sat in the waiting area over 1-1/2 hrs (I waited because I understand business, and things do happen) without anyone informing me of any delays. I left without recieving any service.

Don't set expectations and then not fulfill them without an explanation, before money walks out the door.

resp.text: Chase, we appreciate you taking the time to leave us a review and for the feedback on your visit. We apologize if any part of your experience was less than satisfactory and we hope to have the opportunity in the future to work with you. If there is anything else that we are able to help with please feel free to give us a call.

name: Ben Turner
text:
Been using these guys for about a year since moving to Alabaster. Their hourly rate is the cheapest I have found anywhere and they always take care of my problems on both my cars. Oil changes are only about $22 and that includes a tire rotation and they don't try to upsell you on a bunch of crap you don't need like alot of other places in the area who offer cheap oil changes and then make it up with additional "needs fixing items".

The mechanics and the 2 gentlemen at the front desk are always helpful, and courteous even though they are always busy and I can't thank them enough.

I don't believe for a second these 2 reviews that say they did such a poor job and accept that some people are never happy unless they can drag everyone else into the misery pit where they reside.

Thanks Alabaster Auto and I will continue to use you and recommend you to my friends as long as I am in this area.

Ben

The most recent vist to purchase tires for my car was not so good. It was shocking enough that the owner helping me abruptly left for a lunch engagement in the middle of the sale promising to call me after lunch. Even more so when I never received the call back to order the tires. Needless to say I took my business elsewhere and won't be returning.

name: Tom Kozar
text: An honest owner and hard-working, skilled mechanics. Mike, the owner, is friendly and professional. He takes the time to explain the issue and the repair needed to correct it. I have had other shops like 10-minute oil change chains tell me I needed work done on my car, taken it to Hampton Cove Auto and had Mike tell me "You are good, there is nothing wrong with your car."  I have been a customer of Hampton Cove Auto for 17 years, highly recommend!

name: Timothy Wyant
text: Timothy Wyant Google's #1 Review Guide!  Very friendly and fast service. Took the time to discuss all work being done before starting. Thank you I'll sure return again.

name: Adam Henson
text: I had an urgent repair last minute before a long trip to the beach and they did a great job at a good price. They also fixed my wife’s air conditioner and it works perfectly. This is a family owned shop and the lead mechanic is the owner. He doesn’t pay someone to do the work for him so you know the work is done right. I recommend this shop

text: The most amazing HONEST mechanic I’ve ever dealt with. Very reasonable price and very accommodating to my crazy schedule. I truly appreciate everything he did.

name: Dylan Hicks
text:
This is a scam run by Greg Talley. Look up his criminal record and all the lawsuits he's lost.
I'm a former employee. If you'd like info on all the illegal business practices taking place email me at dylanchicks97@gmail.com

resp.text: As i replied to your complaint months ago, you are posting your complaint on the site for Hampton Cove Auto Service. Greg Talley is the operator of Cove Auto, Let me be PERFECTLY clear, Greg Talley has NO association with MY business, Hampton Cove Auto Service. We who work in this  business know how Greg operates.  My name is Michael Cox & i have owned & operated Hampton Cove Auto Service since 1998. And as for you Mr. Hicks you have never been an employee of Hampton Cove Auto Service.

text: This is a great mom and pop auto service center and the staff could not have been more friendly or accommodating. I had an emergency repair and they fixed my suv on the spot without delay. resp.text: we appreciate us the opportunity to help you out. Please, let us know if we can help you with anything again. Thank you

name: John Muhlhauser
text:
December 2017: Amazing customer service! Highly recommend
January 2019: Mike and Jaquata were again fantastic. Not only through their customer service but demonstrated through their technical skills.  I never feel like just "another customer". This family run business is best in town. Excellent service, again highly recommended. I would rate Hampton Cove Auto Service 10 out of 5 Stars if I could.

name: Toby Keef
text: I can not be seen to even get service. I have been by three times to get my vehicle serviced to get told to call on this day or that day. I understand that you are busy but how's about offering a time slot or an appointment.  Often people have to change there life and there families life around to free up a vehicle. Just doesn't seem professional or considerate as a business looking to supply there community and there clients with service.

resp.text: Once again mistaken Hampton Cove Auto for Cove Auto. We set appointments for our customers.

name: Shaun Osborne
text: New management. Used prior to change, always fair. Went by because air quit blowing cold. Asked how much to hook up gauges to test pressure and was told "shouldn't be any charge". The compressor was engaging and disengaging so i figured it might be plugged. The technician hooked it up and saw the high side was too high and low side very low. It was plugged. They tried to say they had to pull codes and all this junk and i told them it runs fine except for the a/c. I shut off the a/c and it ran fine, it would bog down when the compressor engaged. They tried to make more out of it, then charged me $45. Avoid if possible.

resp.text: Not us!! WE have been here since 1998, no new management.

name: Kirk Ward
text: Great Service and always a fair price.

resp.text: Thank you for putting your trust in us.

name: Andrew Raymond Crawford
text: I am looking to purchase a 2002-2006 Cadillac Escalade and I used Hampton Cove Auto Services for the pre-purchase inspection of an example I was considering.  The car seemed ok to me, although I knew there were some issues with the shock absorbers and brakes.  The PPI was the best $55 I ever spent and saved me from getting mired in a long list of reliability problems and expensive repairs that would have equaled the purchase price of the car!  I haven't found the right car yet, but will try to bring a few more examples to Hampton Cove Auto Services until we identify the right one.  As well as having a diligent technical team, I have found Jaquata on the customer service side to be both accommodating and very personable.  My neighbor says she has been happily using Hampton Cove Auto Services for many years and it's very easy to see why.  I will use them again as my first preference auto mechanic.

text: Been going there on and off for 10 years.  Convenient location if you live in Hampton Cove.  Good work with fair price.

Unsure if that employee was trying to just scam and take advantage or this company is just overpriced. It was my first time and would be last.

Glad I researched beforehand. Just be careful and study the materials of service you need done before getting here.

text:
The Manager Chris here is way out of his element. I had my truck towed here for work to be done. Prior to having truck brought there I called and spoke to him to be sure that what I need done would be completed by them.

Without even un-mounting the tire to see the puncture they determined it unfixable and I also couldn’t buy a replacement tire I was required to buy 2 tires.

After trying to sell me some tires that were currently mounted on an employees truck. It turns out they didn’t even have the tires in stock that he said they did.

The technician was a down to earth guy and straight forward but honestly held back by company management. This guy Chris is a money shark and doesn’t show the slightest interest in actually helping anyone. More like a money chasing tyrant with a small man complex.

Their prices are very competitive and some styles are even priced a bit lower. Next time I need another set of tires I won’t even shop around, I’ll be going straight there.

The staff was incredibly friendly and didn't give me the typical "female" treatment that I have received at other shops in the Auburn/Opelika area.  I will definitely return here for service and recommend them to anyone.
